Enum TimeInForce

Namespace
FinSysPlatform.Domain.Market
Assembly
FinSysPlatform.Domain.Market.dll

Time in force types

public enum TimeInForce

Fields

[ShortName("Day")] Day = 1

DAY - Valid for the day only.

[ShortName("FOK")] Fok = 3

FOK - If the entire Fill-or-Kill order does not execute as soon as it becomes available, the entire order is canceled.

[ShortName("GTC")] Gtc = 0

GTC - Good until canceled.The order will continue to work within the system and in the marketplace until it executes or is canceled.

[ShortName("GTD")] Gtd = 5

GTD. - Good until Date.It will remain working within the system and in the marketplace until it executes or until the close of the market on the date specified

[ShortName("IOC")] Ioc = 2

IOC - Immediate or Cancel. Any portion that is not filled as soon as it becomes available in the market is canceled.

[ShortName("OPG")] Opg = 4

OPG orders are qualified as At-the-Open. An OPG qualifier requests that your order will be executed as close to the opening price as possible. Any unfilled orders after opening of the market will be cancelled. OPG - Use OPG to send a market-on-open(MOO) or limit-on-open(LOO) order.

Remarks

See a classic set of time-in-force values in FIX API: https://www.onixs.biz/fix-dictionary/4.4/tagnum_59.html Also, see https://www.interactivebrokers.com/en/software/tws/usersguidebook/ordertypes/time_in_force_for_orders.htm for explanation how TIF works
